title: Textile, 15th century
medium:
Medium: silk, gilded parchment wound around linen core
Technique: two interconnected structures: 4&1 satin and weft faced plain weave (lampas)
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 42.5 x 33 cm (16 3/4 x 13 in.)
description: Fragment of woven silk with eight-pointed stars containing regardant leopards alternating with palmettes and leaf forms. The stars are formed from parallelograms with lattice-like fillings. The leopard paris are surrounded by inlaced bands and pointed foliage. In cream and gold on a dark blue ground.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 15th century.
15th century. Medium: silk, gilded parchment wound around linen core
Technique: two interconnected structures: 4&1 satin and weft faced plain weave (lampas). Gift of John Pierpont Morgan. 1902-1-251.
